author: Kagemusha08

text:
Well, maybe if it was a budget release for like $15 to $20 it might have worked out better. At the time of it's release many people didn't have a DSI so the chances of it selling well were even slimer.

And do be fair, it's VERY rare for a platformer these days to do well unless it's first-party, or a popular indie game on xbla or something.

text:
The game was too short for a retail game. Plus, even though it looks fantastic, it's not really graphically impressive since it was originally developed for the GBA.
Not to mention that platformers on a Nintendo console that aren't mario don't do too well most of the time.
